intro: Nekemias grossedentata, commonly known as the toothed nekemias, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, toothed leaves and vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and ability to attract pollinators. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
